stream_context.summary: Kaze fine-tunes the new "egg-coin radar" for Mission 7, fixes a lighting spawn bug, and outlines coin economy, demo plans, and late-game course themes.

development_findings.summary: Mission 7 now universally becomes “Find the Egg Coins,” expanding the act list from six to seven and permanently equipping players with a radar instead of selling it as an item.
development_findings.quote: Imagine you have not bought the radar and you're doing Mission 7 and the game doesn't give you any hint at all—that's gonna suck.

development_findings.summary: The original 100-coin star has been scrapped; coins are now global and will fund overworld upgrades (e.g., donating 500 coins to build a bridge).
development_findings.quote: You're actually gonna affect the world by giving people money—that's gonna be so cool.

development_findings.summary: Radar feedback is being prototyped: initial blinking color system conflicts with level-specific coin colors; Kaze experiments with transparency that increases with proximity.
development_findings.quote: The closer you are to it, the more solid it gets.

development_findings.summary: Objects with behParam3 = 255 do not spawn in the SM64 engine; this setting was preventing dynamic lights from appearing until Kaze discovered and changed it.
development_findings.quote: There's a functionality in the Mario 64 engine where if you set the bhv param 3 to 255 the object does not spawn—this is so wild.

development_findings.summary: All 15 main courses are now planned; Course 13 = Ice Castle, Course 14 = Craft World, Course 15 = Space Arcade, though late-game areas still need work.
Kaze removed rumble-pack support to avoid adding a dedicated thread on N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: I have disabled the rumble pack so far; it requires a whole new thread.

development_findings.summary: Lighting on Mario looked broken in the last showcase but has since been corrected.
development_findings.quote: The lighting on Mario was very broken—I fixed it since the last showcase.

development_findings.summary: First public demo is nearly ready; remaining tasks are mostly bug fixes (dynamic lights) and inserting Biobak’s mushroom assets. A second demo will later focus solely on Course 1.
development_findings.quote: There will be a second demo and the second demo will be only Course 1.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prioritizes player experience over optional challenge, adjusting mechanics to avoid frustration.
context_findings.quote: I want to avoid that experience happening to anyone.

context_findings.summary: He dislikes frequent mandatory updates in tooling (specifically ParaLLEl Launcher) and prefers convenience.
context_findings.quote: No, it's good that the software is supported—it's still fucking annoying.

context_findings.summary: Kaze openly dislikes most 2D games and focuses on 3D design.
context_findings.quote: I probably wouldn't like Pizza Tower because I don't like 2D games.

context_findings.summary: He remarks on minimal personal possessions and downplays self-focus during streams.
context_findings.quote: I only own like five or six shirts … I think about game, not about me.

biobak.summary: Providing a new line of mushroom models that Kaze needs to integrate.
biobak.quote: There is a line of mushrooms that Biobak is working on that I need to put in.

biobak.summary: Gives feedback on radar visuals during stream.

zeina.summary: Zeina is present on stream but only ‘chilling,’ with no development tasks mentioned.

key_stories.title: Radar Redesign Pivot
key_stories.summary: Kaze originally intended the egg-coin radar to be an optional purchasable item but realized players could lock themselves into a frustrating hunt. He moved the radar to be automatically granted in Mission 7 and iterated on its visual feedback.
key_stories.challenge: Optional radar risked making Mission 7 unfair for players who didn’t buy it.
key_stories.process: Changed act list to seven stars, auto-enabled radar, experimented with blinking colors, then transparency.
key_stories.outcome: A mandatory radar with evolving visual design that balances guidance and treasure-hunt feel.
key_stories.key_quote: Instead of six stars there's now seven; the last act is always called ‘Find the Egg Coins’ and you get a radar.

key_stories.title: Invisible Lights Bug
key_stories.summary: Dynamic crystal lights in a cave refused to spawn during testing.
key_stories.challenge: Lights placed in the level were inactive with no visible cause.
key_stories.process: Inspected object parameters and discovered SM64’s hidden rule that bhv param 3 set to 255 suppresses spawning.
key_stories.outcome: Lights render correctly after parameter adjustment.
key_stories.key_quote: If you set the bhv param 3 to 255 the object does not spawn—this is so wild.

key_stories.title: Reinventing the Coin Economy
key_stories.summary: The team replaces Mario 64’s 100-coin star with globally collected coins that fund overworld changes.
key_stories.challenge: Traditional 100-coin mission felt redundant and didn’t fit new game loop.
key_stories.process: Recast coins as currency for world upgrades, removing per-level 100-coin stars.
key_stories.outcome: Coins now unlock tangible overworld alterations, increasing their perceived value.
key_stories.key_quote: The coins are gonna feel more valuable than Mario Odyssey.
